intro: Cryptantha barbigera, commonly known as the hairy cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Cryptantha barbigera is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes.
